Detailed Description

This class represents a TinyJava assignment statement.

An assignment statement has:

  • a left-hand side, which may be a simple name (a variable, parameter, or a class field), or an array reference with a subscript expression. A pointer to the symbol table ENTRY for the name may also be included.
  • a right-hand side, which is an expression.

ENTRY should be defined as a macro, and its value should be a class, which is the root of the symbol table entry hierarchy. Its default value is Entry. The macro should be defined at the beginning of the header file Ast.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AssignStatement::AssignStatement ( int  lineNo,
const char *  lhsName,
Expression *  rhs 
)

Create a assignment statement node, where the left-hand side is a simple variable, parameter, or a class field.

Parameters:
lineNo is a source line number with the assignment statement
lhsName is the name on the left-hand side of this assignment
rhs is a pointer to an expression node representing the right-hand side expression
Exceptions:
AstException if the lhs or the rhs is NULL
AssignStatement::AssignStatement ( int  lineNo,
const char *  lhsName,
Expression *  idx,
Expression *  rhs 
)

Create a assignment statement node, where the left-hand side is a simple variable, parameter, or a class field.

Parameters:
lineNo is a source line number.
lhsName is the name on the left-hand side of this assignment.
idx is a pointer to an expression node representing the index (subscript) expression.
rhs is a pointer to an expression node representing the right-hand side expression.
Exceptions:
AstException if the lhs or the rhs is NULL
